content: On July 26, 1991, the Atlanta Braves faced off against the Cincinnati Reds in a thrilling game that showcased the brilliance of pitcher Tom Glavine. Glavine delivered a masterful performance, throwing a complete game and allowing only one run, leading the Braves to a 5-1 victory. This game was part of a remarkable season that ultimately saw the Braves reach the World Series, marking the beginning of a dominant era in Atlanta baseball.
